clues.clue:
Where royal namesake stands in stately grace,
And commerce weds with time's enduring trace,
Seek The Prince of Wales in market's embrace—
There painted dreams descend through azure space,
As "Parachuting Pies" drift into place.
clues.base_clue: In the shadow of The Prince of Wales, among the grand shopping thoroughfares, discover the painted wonder "Parachuting Pies".

clues.clue: The painted piece "Parachuting Pies" adorns a commercial storefront on a brick building with large display windows, positioned 16m north of The Prince of Wales pub and 25m from Halifax bank, with public seating 57m away and Clarence Square 101m to the southeast.
clues.base_clue: The painted piece "Parachuting Pies" adorns a busy shop front, positioned 16m north of The Prince of Wales and 25m from Halifax.

clues.clue: Start at The Prince of Wales pub as your initial landmark. From the pub's main entrance, orient yourself to face due north using a compass. Walk straight north along the pavement for exactly 16 meters, counting your steps carefully. As you walk, keep your eyes scanning to the right (east side) of your path. After covering the 16-meter distance, turn your head to the right (eastward direction) and you will spot the artwork mounted on the wall of a large retail building. The building is a substantial commercial structure with multiple stories and wide frontage typical of retail establishments. The artwork "Parachuting Pies" is a painted mural created in 2013, executed in paint medium, featuring pictorial elements combined with street art styling. The piece depicts pies with parachutes in a whimsical artistic representation. For additional reference, Halifax bank branch serves as a secondary landmark located 25 meters from your starting point at The Prince of Wales. Other nearby reference points include public seating 57 meters away, Clarence Square 101 meters distant, Russell Square 143 meters away, Church of Scientology of Brighton at 158 meters, and Chapel in the Inn 196 meters from your location.
clues.base_clue: Start at The Prince of Wales. Head north for 16m. The artwork will be on your right. Halifax is 25m away. "Parachuting Pies" is a painted artwork featuring pictorial and street art, created in 2013 displayed on a multi-storey shopping complex.

clues.clue:
Where twisted lanes of ages past weave shadows dark and deep,
And Riddle & Finns stands sentinel where ancient secrets sleep,
There "Prinny" dwells in painted grace upon a weathered wall,
A brushstroke prince in colors bright, awaiting your sweet call.
clues.base_clue: Where Riddle & Finns The Lanes stands proud, among the old town's narrow passages, the painted artwork "Prinny" awaits.

clues.clue: The painted piece "Prinny" adorns a historic stone building, positioned 18m northeast of The Secret Comedy Club and 19m from Paxton+Glew Contemporary Art Gallery, with Royal Pavilion Gardens located 152m away and B&Q Local - Brighton 160m from the artwork's location.
clues.base_clue: The painted piece "Prinny" adorns a centuries-old property, positioned 18m northeast of The Secret Comedy Club and 19m from Paxton+Glew Contemporary Art Gallery.

clues.clue: Start at The Secret Comedy Club, located on the ground floor of a Victorian terraced building with distinctive black-painted facade and illuminated comedy club signage. Exit the venue and turn to face northeast (45° from north). Walk precisely 18 meters northeast along the pavement, passing The Chapel Royal Brighton (a Georgian limestone church with classical columns and ornate stonework) which will be visible 60 meters to your east. After walking exactly 18 meters, turn your head left (northwest direction) to locate the artwork. You will find "Prinny" - a painted street art piece created circa 2023 - displayed on the exterior wall of a narrow medieval building constructed of weathered grey stone with timber framing and small leaded windows. The figurative artwork depicts a male subject rendered in contemporary street art style using paint medium, with vibrant colors contrasting against the historic stonework. Continue northeast for an additional 1 meter (total 19 meters from starting point) to reach Paxton+Glew Contemporary Art Gallery, housed in a converted Georgian townhouse with white-painted stucco facade and large plate glass windows displaying rotating exhibitions. Additional landmarks include Royal Pavilion Gardens 152 meters southeast, and Friends Meeting House 93 meters north-northwest from the artwork location.
clues.base_clue: Start at The Secret Comedy Club. Head northeast for 18m. The artwork will be on your left. Paxton+Glew Contemporary Art Gallery is 19m away. "Prinny" is a painted artwork featuring figurative and male and street art, created in c.2023 displayed on an ancient structure.

Past medieval whispers carved in stone and mortar's golden token,
Seek the sanctuary where Las Iguanas dwells in shadow's embrace,
There flames of artistry dance eternal—"Burn It All" awaits your grace.

clues.clue: Start at Kellie Miller Arts Gallery, positioned on the corner of the historic cobblestone street. Exit the gallery's main entrance and turn to face northeast (approximately 45 degrees from due north). Walk straight ahead in a northeastern direction for exactly 23 meters, passing the weathered stone fountain landmark on your right after 15 meters. Continue until you reach the second landmark - a distinctive Victorian lamp post with ornate ironwork. The artwork will be immediately on your left (west-facing) side. The target location is a narrow three-story medieval stone building with Gothic arched windows, timber framing on the upper floors, and a slate roof. "Modern Day Hero" is a large painted panel artwork measuring approximately 3m x 2m, created in 2020/2021, featuring commemorative street art with symbolic imagery including heroic figures and community motifs rendered in bold blues, reds, and golds. The artwork is tagged as: Commemorative, Street Art, and Symbolic. For reference, the REDEEMED CHRISTIAN CHURCH OF GOD, LOVE CHAPEL is located exactly 27 meters to the southeast from this position.

"Modern Day Hero" is a painted artwork featuring commemorative and street art and symbolic, created in 2020/2021 displayed on a centuries-old property.

The Kracken coiled where the world terminates,
Its painted tentacles forever dance
Near the Crescent's verdant circumstance.
